heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 07 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (191°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.3°C) and outside temperature (down 2.3°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 8 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.1°C) and feels like temperature (up 3.1°C) when compared to today.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 1181m and a high of 2400m, averaging 2630m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and sunlight levels will peak at very high intensity. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
